bugs.title: CVE-2023-24538 golang: html/template: backticks not treated as string delimiters

bugzilla.short_desc: CVE-2023-24538 golang: html/template: backticks not treated as string delimiters

long_desc.thetext:
Templates did not properly consider backticks (`) as Javascript string delimiters, and as such did
not escape them as expected. Backticks are used, since ES6, for JS template literals. If a template
contained a Go template action within a Javascript template literal, the contents of the action could
be used to terminate the literal, injecting arbitrary Javascript code into the Go template.

References:

https://github.com/golang/go/issues/59234
https://github.com/golang/go/issues/59272

Affects: fedora-all [bug 2189000]

bugs.title: CVE-2023-24537 golang: go/parser: Infinite loop in parsing

bugzilla.short_desc: CVE-2023-24537 golang: go/parser: Infinite loop in parsing

long_desc.thetext:
Calling any of the Parse functions on Go source code which contains //line directives with very large line numbers can cause an infinite loop due to integer overflow.

References:

https://github.com/golang/go/issues/59180

bugs.title: CVE-2023-24539 golang: html/template: improper sanitization of CSS values

bugzilla.short_desc: CVE-2023-24539 golang: html/template: improper sanitization of CSS values

long_desc.thetext: Angle brackets (<>) were not considered dangerous characters when inserted into CSS contexts. Templates containing multiple actions separated by a '/' character could result in unexpectedly closing the CSS context and allowing for injection of unexpected HMTL, if executed with untrusted input.

bugzilla.short_desc: CVE-2023-29400 golang: html/template: improper handling of empty HTML attributes

long_desc.thetext: Templates containing actions in unquoted HTML attributes (e.g. "attr={{.}}") executed with empty input could result in output that would have unexpected results when parsed due to HTML normalization rules. This may allow injection of arbitrary attributes into tags.

type=security

# low, medium, high, urgent (required)

# testing, stable
request=testing

# Bug numbers: 1234,9876

# Description of your update

# Enable request automation based on the stable/unstable karma thresholds
autokarma=True
stable_karma=3
unstable_karma=-3

# Automatically close bugs when this marked as stable

# Suggest that users restart after update
suggest_reboot=False
